question_text: Which of the following most accurately describes a core advantage of SaaS in terms of scalability?
answer_options: Users must manually deploy virtual machines as needed
Performance scaling requires direct OS access
The provider handles all application scaling in the background
Customers use a script to add new physical servers
correct_answer: The provider handles all application scaling in the background
explanation: SaaS abstracts infrastructure complexity, and providers automatically scale the application as demand increases.
